abstracts.cdata!:
Project outcome is rated as
            satisfactory, while project sustainability is rated as
            highly likely. The performances of the world Bank and the
            Borrower were rated satisfactory. The Fiscal TA Project
            offers several lessons: 1) Strong commitment of the
            Government is instrumental in institutional reforms: Under
            each of the project components, the process and results of
            implementation indicate that without a clear signal from the
            top of the Government, institutional reforms are difficult
            to implement. Government priorities also affect the
            incentives and ability of Government officials to
            participate in capacity building activities. 2) The World
            Bank's contribution is vital in facilitating the
            transfer of expertise: Several implementing agencies,
            including the State Administration of Taxation (SAT) and the
            Budget and Treasury Departments of the Ministry of Finance
            (MOF), indicated that, although their original emphasis
            under the project was on obtaining equipment, they have
            learned that the World Bank's contribution was most
            vital in facilitating and adapting appropriate international
            expertise, in promoting broad-based human capacity building,
            and in establishing knowledge-sharing and networking
            arrangements that would last well beyond the life of the
            project. 3) The evolution of Government priorities affects
            system design. It became apparent particularly in the tax
            administration component, that the most urgent priorities of
            the Government may marginalize other considerations
            important to design systems for a longer-term use. While the
            China Tax Administration Information System (CTAIS) system
            clearly made an enormous contribution to improving the
            Government revenue performance, it was built around the
            1995/96 Government's urgent objective of improving
            control and compliance in tax collection. Other objectives
            relevant for system design, such as efficiency, convenience
            and user-friendliness were not adequately reflected in the
            original design. Marginalization of these softer objectives
            in the original design, along with the continuing emergence
            of new technical tools (such as wider use of the internet
            and telecommunication network) since the original design was
            completed, may necessitate future changes in the system.

abstracts.cdata!:
The Fiscal Technical Assistance Project
            will assist in implementing the current fiscal reforms and
            preparing future reforms. The project will support the
            fiscal reforms by: (a) developing and implementing a new tax
            administration; (b) strengthening capacity for tax policy
            analysis; (c) developing and implementing a
            central-provincial grants scheme; and (d) improving
            budgetary process and practices. The project will contribute
            to improved management of public resources.
